name: Servier
description: French pharmaceutical company. Acquired Agios oncology portfolio in April 2021 including ivosidenib vorasidenib and enasidenib.

name: Bristol-Myers Squibb
description: Global biopharma with legacy in hypomethylating agents through Celgene acquisition

name: Ipsen
description: Acquired Epizyme and their EZH2 inhibitor platform in June 2022

name: Novartis
description: Global pharma with HDAC inhibitor Farydak for multiple myeloma. Acquired MorphoSys May 2024

name: Acrotech Biopharma
description: Subsidiary of Aurobindo Pharma. Acquired belinostat and other oncology drugs from Spectrum March 2019

name: Chipscreen Biosciences
description: Chinese biotech pioneer in HDAC inhibitors

name: Rigel Pharmaceuticals
description: Biotechnology company focused on hematology-oncology. Licensed olutasidenib from Forma Aug 2022

name: MorphoSys
description: Acquired Constellation's pelabresib BET inhibitor platform. Acquired by Novartis May 2024

name: Prelude Therapeutics
description: Clinical-stage epigenetics-focused oncology company

name: Constellation Pharmaceuticals
description: Pioneer in BET inhibitors - acquired by MorphoSys 2021

name: Omega Therapeutics
description: Programmable epigenetics using mRNA medicines. Filed Chapter 11 Feb 2025

name: Tune Therapeutics
description: Epigenetic editing using zinc finger technology

name: Epicrispr Biotechnologies
description: CRISPR-based epigenetic editing for rare diseases

name: Chroma Medicine
description: Epigenetic editing platform for precision medicines

name: Verve Therapeutics
description: Gene editing for cardiovascular disease. Acquired by Eli Lilly July 2025

name: Syndax Pharmaceuticals
description: Developing menin inhibitors and other targeted oncology. First-in-class revumenib approved Nov 2024

name: Oryzon Genomics
description: European leader in LSD1 and other epigenetic targets

name: Merck
description: First FDA-approved HDAC inhibitor Zolinza (vorinostat) for CTCL

name: Curis
description: Clinical-stage oncology with multiple HDAC inhibitor programs

name: Janssen
description: J&J subsidiary developing quisinostat. Has EU/ROW rights to decitabine

name: Xynomic Pharma
description: Developing abexinostat HDAC inhibitor for solid tumors and lymphomas

name: Pfizer
description: Global pharma with discontinued HDAC inhibitor program

name: Agios Pharmaceuticals
description: Pioneer in cancer metabolism. Sold oncology portfolio to Servier 2021 but retained royalty rights

name: Otsuka Pharmaceutical
description: Japanese pharmaceutical company. Acquired US/Canada/Japan rights to decitabine from Eisai 2014

name: Gilead Sciences
description: Global biopharma focused on virology and oncology

name: Forma Therapeutics
description: IDH inhibitor developer. Olutasidenib licensed to Rigel. Acquired by Novo Nordisk Oct 2022

name: Spectrum Pharmaceuticals
description: Specialty pharma. Sold oncology portfolio to Acrotech 2019. Acquired by Assertio 2023
